sub_topic: Spectroscopic techniques for studying coordination compounds
message_1: What is the coordination number and geometry of [Fe(H2O)6]2+ complex ion using UV-Vis spectroscopy?
message_2:
The coordination number of the [Fe(H2O)6]2+ complex ion is 6, as there are six water molecules (H2O) surrounding the central iron (Fe) atom. The geometry of this complex ion is octahedral, as the six ligands are arranged symmetrically around the central metal atom, with each ligand occupying a vertex of an octahedron. 

UV-Vis spectroscopy can be used to study the electronic transitions in the complex, which can provide information about the geometry and coordination number. In the case of [Fe(H2O)6]2+, the UV-Vis spectrum would show a characteristic absorption band due to the d-d transition of the central Fe(II) ion in an octahedral environment.
